items.headline: I’m 70 and have Alzheimer’s. My son’s girlfriend put $750 worth of lottery tickets on a credit card I gave him. What can I do?
items.summary_en: “I contacted the credit-card company, but was advised they could not reimburse me for the theft.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: My uncle’s widow is threatening to sue me. She wants money from my grandmother’s estate. Should I be worried?
items.summary_en: “My uncle said he had recorded my grandmother saying she would change the will and add him as the beneficiary.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Intel’s explosive stock gains this year are unsustainable, a new bear warns
items.summary_en: HSBC sees 35% downside potential for Intel’s stock, cautioning that the company would need a technology deal with TSMC to spark a true turnaround — and that looks unlikely.

items.headline: Equifax’s credit-score pricing counterpunch draws praise for potential profit boost
items.summary_en: Equifax could realize $100 million of profit if mortgage activity remains at 2025 levels, or even up to $200 million if mortgages recover.

items.headline: I’m retiring at 63 with $1.5 million saved. Is 70/30 equities/bonds too risky?
items.summary_en: “My spouse and I have a combined $5,500 in monthly Social Security payments and a $2,900-a-month pension.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Inflation was eating me alive in retirement, so I went back to work. I’m now 66. Was I right?
items.summary_en: “Be more concerned with outliving inflation than Social Security.”

items.headline: Goldman Sachs on the one thing that could turn the rally into a bubble
items.summary_en: Goldman Sachs strategists have taken a deep dive into current stock bubble worries for investors. They argue the puzzle pieces aren’t in place yet.

items.headline: Why two Rust Belt towns have the fastest-growing home prices in the U.S.
items.summary_en: These former manufacturing hubs in eastern Pennsylvania and upstate New York saw the sharpest growth in home prices in September, according to Intercontinental Exchange.

items.headline: This ‘boring’ stock and bond portfolio won’t give you bragging rights — but it does make you money
